com.samskivert.util
Class Histogram

java.lang.Object
  com.samskivert.util.Histogram
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
public class Histogram
extends Object
implements Cloneable

Used for tracking a set of values that fall into a discrete range of values.

Constructor Summary
Histogram(int minValue, int bucketWidth, int bucketCount)
          Constructs a histogram that will track values with a granularity equal to the bucketWidth from minValue to minValue + bucketWidth*bucketCount.
 
Method Summary
 void addValue(int value)
          Registers a value with this histogram.
 void clear()
          Clears the values from this histogram.
 Histogram clone()
           
 int[] getBuckets()
          Returns the array containing the bucket values.
 int size()
          Returns the total number of values in the histogram.
 String summarize()
          Generates a terse summary of the count and contents of the values in this histogram.
 String toString()

equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Histogram

public Histogram(int minValue,
                 int bucketWidth,
                 int bucketCount)
Constructs a histogram that will track values with a granularity equal to the bucketWidth from minValue to minValue + bucketWidth*bucketCount.

Method Detail

addValue

public void addValue(int value)
Registers a value with this histogram.

size

public int size()
Returns the total number of values in the histogram.

clear

public void clear()
Clears the values from this histogram.

getBuckets

public int[] getBuckets()
Returns the array containing the bucket values. The zeroth element contains the count of all values less than minValue, the subsequent bucketCount elements contain the count of values falling into those buckets and the last element contains values greater than or equal to maxValue.

summarize

public String summarize()
Generates a terse summary of the count and contents of the values in this histogram.
